title.narrative: Avian Influenza Preparedness and Response Project

description.narrative: The overall objective of the Project is to minimize the threat posed by highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) to humans in Bangladesh by controlling such infections in domestic poultry, and preparing for, controlling, and responding to possible human infections, especially an influenza epidemic and related emergencies. Though the objective is specific to HPAI, the interventions are expected to contribute to the control of other zoonotic diseases and other types of infectious diseases, in terms of building overall response capacity in the country.

title.narrative: Evidence of improved effectiveness of animal and public health services to an HPAI outbreak and/or pandemic.(a) National Plan prepared and accepted by FAO, WHO and OIE.

baseline.value: National Plan prepared with the technical assistance from FAO and WHO.

target.value: The National Plan prepared, approved and operational.

comment.narrative: This revised Plan was published in March 2009.

title.narrative: National AI Strategy/Plan adopted by the government and updated periodically.

baseline.value: The National Plan prepared, approved and operational.

target.value: First updating by Year 2 and second updating by Year 4.

comment.narrative: National AI Plan for 2006-08 has been revised/updated for 2009-11 with the technical assistance from FAO and WHO, and is stillawaiting formal approval by the Government,[ pending at the Human Health sector.] Operational Manual prepared and in conformitywith FAOand OIE guidelines. Preparatory meetings for revising the National AI Plan for 2011-16 are being held since April 2011.

title.narrative: Risk communication strategy approved and adopted by the Government.

baseline.value: UNICEF and other UN-agencies assisted the Government to finalize the strategy and Action Plan.

target.value: Risk communication strategy approved by the Government and adopted using consistent messages in a systematic way involvingrelevantstakeholders.

comment.narrative: The second round of the Knowledge, Aptitude and Practice (KAP) survey report has been published by UNICEF in September 2010.

title.narrative: Compensation strategy for the affected poultry farmers approved and operational.

baseline.value: The Compensation strategy approved as a part of the Government's Development Project Proforma, and adopted.

target.value: The Compensation strategy approved and operational.

actual.value: The Compensation strategy approved and operational

comment.narrative: The Governments has revised/ updated compensation strategy twice in 2011 (in January and April) and compensation rates for allcategories of birds were updated to align with market prices. About $2.07m in compensation was disbursed to 620 poultryfarms/farmers whose stock had to be culled.

title.narrative: Emergency supplies procured and available at strategic locations in the field.

comment.narrative: Being carried out based on the assessment of stock at the central DLS ware house.

title.narrative: Assessment of veterinary services completed and development plan prepared.

target.value: By Project Year 2, the planned assessment is completed with a development plan.

comment.narrative: DLS initiated contacts with OIE in January 2011 and now, planned in 2011.

title.narrative: Ninety percent of national Reference laboratory results fully consistent with OIE Reference lab results.

target.value: From Project-Year 2, 90%.

title.narrative: National communication strategy for pandemic influenza operationalized and materials and messages prepared and disseminated.National communication strategy available.

target.value: 100% from Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: National Avian and Pandemic Influenza Communication strategy has been revised in association with UNICEF and others. The secondround of the Knowledge, Aptitude and Practice (KAP) survey report, published in September 2010.

title.narrative: Staff is trained in surveillance and diagnostic methods.treatment courses

target.value: 100% by end of Project-year 4.

comment.narrative: 15 training workshop on surveillance completed for Asstt Animal Health Workers and 3 for Vet Officers are underway. Laboratorystaff trained under other ongoing projects - numbers to be assessed.

title.narrative: 80% of targeted journalists are aware of good practices for reporting on HPAI.NIL

comment.narrative: 600 journalists trained under UNICEF-implemented project as of Nov 7 2007.

title.narrative: Protocol signed between DLS and partner agencies like Forest Dept, NGOs etc.NIL

target.value: 100% by end of Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: Abandoned as Dept of Forest is not willing to participate in the monitoring/surveillance.

title.narrative: Average monitoring coverage of high risk areas.

target.value: Project-year 2, 25%; Y3, 50%; and Y3, 75%.

comment.narrative: All high risk areas in 51 districts, 306 Upazilas and 15 metro-Thanas are covered under current surveillance program. FromOctober 1, 2010, this project in association with USAID jointly manage, surveillance in 260 Upazilas and started in 46 new Upazilas

title.narrative: Laboratory equipment and materials are procured, distributed and installed. Emergency supplies procured and available at strategic locations in the field.

target.value: 50% by Year 1 and 100% by Year 2.

comment.narrative: Completed renovation and provision of supplies and equipment to six of the seven Field Labs and the remaining one at Feni isexpected to be completed in May 2011. Construction of a new Field lab at Jessore is underway, and civil works are planned to becompleted by February 2012. Assessing environmental and biosafety procedures in the lab network was completed. Curriculum fortraining lab technicians is under development and training will be conducted in June 2011.

title.narrative: Reporting of unusual wild bird deaths and sample collection satisfactorily done covering 75% of the identified locations.NIL

target.value: 100% from Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: Crows died in many places during 2nd wave of outbreak (Sep. 07- May 08) and media reported it. In 2010-11, crows were found dyingin Dhaka and few district towns.

title.narrative: Baseline developed for monitoring and evaluating Project impact.NIL

target.value: Baseline data collected by end of Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: M&E Consulting Firm to be hired by June 2011.

title.narrative: Periodical/annual desk top and field exercises organized to simulate the possible events of outbreak.NIL

comment.narrative: May not be relevant in most of the locations where outbreaks have taken place.

title.narrative: HH: Sentinel sites (i) submitting weekly reports on ILI incidence; (ii) collecting and testing at least five samples per month; (iii) submitting samples to IEDCR for influenza testing.

target.value: Project-year 1, 43%; Y2, 68%; Y3, 87% and Y4, 87%.

comment.narrative: Surveillance is being carried out through the existing 12 surveillance sites under the joint IEDCR ICDDRB project. 18 more s/sitesare being set-up. Procurement complete and Lab will be setup soon.

title.narrative: HH: At least 100 influenza-related investigations done annually by district and national rapid response teams.NIL

target.value: Project-year 1, 25 Y2, 50; Y3, 75; and Y4, 100 nos.

comment.narrative: The 100 flu investigations were supposed to be from 18 sentinel sites, which are currently being set up. The #progress to date#value comes from routine ILI investigations by 12 existing sentinel sites with CDC/ICDDR,B fund.

title.narrative: Overall, vaccination strategy developed and approved.NIL

target.value: Vaccination strategy developed and approved by end of Project year 1.

comment.narrative: The current policy of the Government is not to vaccinate poultry.

title.narrative: Reporting and reaction time for suspected cases of AI is reduced to the minimally acceptable levels.NIL

comment.narrative: To be evaluated.

title.narrative: Program reports, financial monitoring, procurement and disbursement reports, audits, management and financial reports prepared and submitted periodically.NIL

target.value: Starting from Project-year 1 till completion on a regular basis.

title.narrative: 80% of targeted backyard poultry farmers adopt recommended practices.
100% of targeted commercial poultry farmers adopt recommended practices.NIL
Complete national monitoring of poultry (backyard and commercial farms) through sound sampling methods.NIL

target.value: Base line by Project-year 1; MTR in Y3 and EOP Review in Y5.

title.narrative: Compensation provided to poultry owners rapidly and in a monitorable way.Not known

target.value: 100% compensation provided to poultry owners following the agreed guidelines from Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: The payment to the affected firms/farmers are being made within four weeks and can be tracked. So far, US$2.06 million paid. Postverification to be done.

title.narrative: Movement control and quarantine measures are effectively enforced in the infected/control zone.

target.value: Movement control and quarantine measures are effectively enforced in the infected/control zone from Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: Given the reduced confirmation time and new strategy for culling, it appears that containment measures are working better since2009.

title.narrative: Culling, disposal and disinfection activities completed, as needed.

target.value: 100% in case of each outbreak site/farm from Project-year 1.

comment.narrative: Initially 100% culling within 1 km of the infected farm- about poultry birds culled so far. Revised to : (i) comm. farms-infectedfarm only and (ii) 0.5 km radious for backyrad farms.

title.narrative: Operational Manual updated on a regular basis and strictly practiced.

target.value: First updating by end of Project -Year 1, and second updating by end ofProject -Year 3.

actual.value: Revised draft ready- yet to be approved.

comment.narrative: Draft revised Standard Operating Procedures (SOP) distributed to labs. Still awaiting final approval.

title.narrative: Operational Manual for the Plan conforms with the guidelines of FAO/OIE and GPAI.

baseline.value: Operational Manual finalized with FAO-assistance and approved by the MOFL.

target.value: Operation Manual finalized and adopted in operations.

comment.narrative: Operational Manual prepared and in conformity with FAO and OIE guidelines. This needs approval and should be used in the field/labwith due diligence.

title.narrative: (a) Evidence of improved effectiveness of animal and public health services to an HPAI outbreak and/or pandemic.(b) Contained anddiminishing pattern of HPAI infection in poultry.

baseline.value: b) Out breaks confirmed in 20 out of 64 districts.

target.value: End of project reduced by 80%.

comment.narrative: After a decline of HPAI outbreaks during 2009-10, the number has increased in early 2011 to 161 outbreaks (as of May 10, 2011).DLSand partners have shown evidence of preparedness and response to deal with this surge in outbreaks.
HNPSP will close on 06/30/2010, which is 3rd year of this AI Project. EOP target is 60 % of EOP target 30,000 staff out of totalavailable staff of 60, 679 (June 30, 2008).

16, 215 health personnel out of total target of 18,000 (under HNPSP) have been trained. They include 5470 physicians, 840 MedicalTechnologist, and 9905 Paramedics. No data on change in knowledge levels among trainees was available.

title.narrative: Health facilities constructed, renovated, and/or equipped

comment.narrative: HNPSP closes on 06/30/2010, which is Y3 of this animal Health Project. EOP target is 69% of total 64 Districts.
Isolation wards in another 34 hospitals are being set up. Country reasonably stocked with PPE and oseltamivir.
